news.title: While AI spending is top of mind, online ads are driving a lot of Big Tech's growth
news.summary: Meta, Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft reported quarterly earnings that showed rising digital ad sales and increased AI infrastructure spending. Meta, Amazon and Alphabet reported quarterly Earnings Snapshots.

news.title: Trump administration must pay SNAP benefits despite government shutdown, judge rules
news.summary: The Justice Department argued that the food stamp program, which feeds more than 40 million Americans, effectively did not exist anymore due to the shutdown.

news.title: Microsoft plans to hire more but with 'a lot more leverage' thanks to AI, CEO Satya Nadella says
news.summary: Microsoft wants to ensure that all of its employees can access its artificial intelligence tools. Microsoft 365 and GitHub Copilot will be available to all employees.

news.title: Millions face 'huge sticker shock' when ACA open enrollment starts Nov. 1
news.summary: Millions of households logging on to enroll in a health plan via the Affordable Care Act marketplace will see much higher premiums. Millions of households log on to sign up for a health care plan via a health insurance marketplace.

news.title: Global week ahead: Is Novo Nordisk past 'peak uncertainty'?
news.summary: CNBC's Charlotte Reed will travel to Copenhagen to speak with Novo Nordisk's new CEO after a bumpy few months. She will also meet with the company's board of directors.

news.title: My husband and I have $7K in Social Security and $2.5 million in stocks. What could go wrong?
news.summary: “I hope to live off of the combination of Social Security and the TIPS ladder,” he says. “I’m not looking to get rich, I just want to get by.”

news.title: My girlfriend, a widow in her 40s, pays off her credit card after every transaction. Is that weird?
news.summary: “I saw her transfer $150 after we were done shopping,” she says. “I’m like, ‘Oh my God, she’s transferring money.’”

news.title: I’m planning to retire at 65 when my twins are 15. How will this impact their healthcare coverage?
news.summary: “By retiring when they are in the 10th grade my income will be low when they apply for college scholarships,” she says.

news.title: ‘I don’t want to worry about money’: I’m 64 with $400K in savings and $700 in Social Security. Can I retire next year?
news.summary: “I take in about $2,200 in monthly rent from four properties,” he says. “I’m not a millionaire, but I’ve made a lot of money.”

news.title: Retiring abroad is touted as a money saver — here’s why it isn’t always cheaper
news.summary: Taxes, investments, healthcare — everything adds up. Here’s how to plan now to relocate later. Here's how to move now to save money later.
